items.content_html:
This PR removes the overflow-clip-box CSS property from BCD. Per the data guidelines, this feature can be considered irrelevant and may be removed from BCD accordingly. Even if the current data suggests that the feature is supported, lack of support has been confirmed by the mdn-bcd-collector project (v10.0.1).

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/css/properties/overflow-clip-box

Additional Notes: The pages for these properties was removed long ago, but the BCD files were left behind. It appears that these are only available in Gecko Chrome code; in other words, internal only. (See https://web.archive.org/web/20200910193159/https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Gecko/Chrome/CSS/overflow-clip-box.)
items.title: Remove overflow-clip-box CSS property from BCD

items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects version values for Chromium (Chrome, Opera, Samsung Internet, WebView Android) for the image-rendering CSS property. The data comes from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v10.0.1).

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/css/properties/image-rendering
items.title: Update Chromium data for image-rendering CSS property

items.content_html: This PR removes the scroll-snap-type-x and scroll-snap-type-y CSS properties from BCD. These properties can now be considered irrelevant as no modern browsers support either of them, as has been confirmed by the mdn-bcd-collector project.
items.title: Remove scroll-snap-type-[x/y]

items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects version values for Firefox and Firefox Android for the font-variant-emoji CSS property. The data comes from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v10.0.1).

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/css/properties/font-variant-emoji

Additional Notes: This is a follow-up to #18381, which set Firefox as supported but did not include the required flag data (which Dipika later pointed out).
items.title: Update Firefox data for font-variant-emoji CSS property

items.content_html: This PR is a follow-up to #17890 that corrects the data for the contain-intrinsic-width and contain-intrinsic-height CSS properties. They were mis-set as Chrome 83, even though the ChromeStatus feature linked on the previous PR indicates support was added in 95. (The other ChromeStatus feature that is marked as supported in Chrome 83 is for the content-size property.)
items.title: Fix data for contain-intrinsic-[height/width]

items.content_html:
This PR removes the activeWorker member of the InstallEvent API from BCD. Per the data guidelines, this feature can be considered irrelevant and may be removed from BCD accordingly. Even if the current data suggests that the feature is supported, lack of support has been confirmed by the mdn-bcd-collector project (v10.0.1).

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/InstallEvent/activeWorker

Additional Notes: I looked through Firefox's IDL and couldn't find any evidence that this was supported any longer.
items.title: Remove api.InstallEvent.activeWorker from BCD

items.content_html:
Summary

Added the auto value to the animation-duration, in order to show support for this value that which was proposed as part of [https://drafts.csswg.org/css-animations-2/#propdef-animation-duration](CSS Animations Level 2), this way users can easily see where this value has been support and from when.

Test results and supporting details

Currently only supported in Chrome 115.

Related issues

Associated MDN Content issues: 26685 & 26687
Associated Bugzilla bugs: 1808410 & 1737920

Associated MDN Content PR - 27075
items.title: 26685 26687 view progress timelines

items.title: Add BCD for isUrlFilterCaseSensitive field

items.content_html:
FF115 adds support for new value option to URLSearchParams.has() and delete() methods. This adds the value.

Lots of tracking info in whatwg/url#735 and testing shows:

  • this is not yet in chrome.
  • Safari says it went into https://developer.apple.com/documentation/safari-technology-preview-release-notes/stp-release-171 which I have marked as preview - is that correct?
  • Node added it in 20.2.0 but latest version is 20.0.0 in BCD. Don't know how I work out engines etc to add that entry - is 20.0.0 close enough?
  • Deno has PR but not yet merged.

Tests on WPT are:

  • https://wpt.live/url/urlsearchparams-delete.any.html
  • https://wpt.live/url/urlsearchparams-has.any.html

Upshot, need to confirm that safari and node values are OK to progress this.

Related docs work can be tracked in mdn/content#27172
items.title: URLSearchParams has() and delete() have new value option

items.content_html:
Summary

Addresses the documentation needs of Bug 1606862 Make devtools an optional permission.

No reference found to this permission in the Chrome documentation e.g. https://developer.chrome.com/docs/extensions/mv3/declare_permissions/#permissions or https://developer.chrome.com/docs/extensions/reference/devtools_inspectedWindow/

Confirmed as included in Safari on this page: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/safariservices/safari_web_extensions/adding_a_web_development_tool_to_safari_web_inspector#3966899
items.title: devtools as optional permission

items.content_html: This PR updates and corrects version values for Firefox and Firefox Android for the SpeechSynthesisVoice API. This bug was discovered when writing tests for the mdn-bcd-collector. This adds a note mentioning this bug and recommending a solution based on GooborgStudios/mdn-bcd-collector@365ad25.
items.title: Update Firefox data for SpeechSynthesisVoice API

Test results and supporting details

items.content_html:
Summary

Compat data about where path() can be used is outdated and inconsistent with other MDN pages, especially clip-path.

This PR aims to fix this and adds an additional row for every place where path() could or could not be used.

Test results and supporting details

I tested that support for path in clip-path was indeed present for the three major browsers, see my comment in #20004.

There is a small mismatch in two version numbers with css.properties.offset-path vs css.types.basic-shape.path:

  • offset-path with path() added in firefox version 72 vs 63
  • offset-path with path() added in chrome version 64 vs 46

I haven't been able to find the truth.

Git logs for chrome 64 contain some mentions of offset-path and path(), but it seems only animation of these was implemented in that release.
Git logs for chrome 46 make no mention of offset-path at all.

Related issues

Fixes #20004, #15961
items.title: Fix incorrect information about path()
